snippet: Asean members declined to point fingers at the region’s top trade partner, while in Vietnam there are also divisions over how to handle China’s forceful maritime assertiveness.
abstract: Vietnamese Prime Min Nguyen Tan Dung accuses China of 'dangerous and serious violations' in territorial dispute that has raised Vietnam's anger at China to highest level in years; comments represent Vietnam's strongest statement since China towed oil rig into disputed waters off coast of Vietnam.

byline.original: By MIKE IVES and THOMAS FULLER
byline.contributor: Mike Ives reported from Hanoi, and Thomas Fuller from Bangkok. Chau Doan contributed reporting from Hanoi, and Wai Moe from Yangon, Myanmar.

lead_paragraph: Asean members declined to point fingers at the region’s top trade partner, while in Vietnam there are also divisions over how to handle China’s forceful maritime assertiveness.

headline.main: Vietnam Fails to Rally Partners in China Dispute
headline.print_headline: Vietnam Fails to Rally Partners in China Dispute
